title: Appeals Court Issues Final Judgment in
html:
News Releases

 

For Immediate Release Contact:  Judith Ingram
October 9, 2012 Julia Queen
  Christian Hilland

 

APPEALS COURT ISSUES FINAL JUDGMENT IN BEAM v. HUNTER

WASHINGTON – The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit today issued its Final Judgment and Order in Beam v. Hunter (Case: 11-3386). The text of the Final Judgment may be found here (http://www.fec.gov/law/litigation/beam_ac_final_judg.pdf). The text of the Order may be found here (http://www.fec.gov/law/litigation/beam_ac_order.pdf).

The Federal Election Commission (FEC) is an independent regulatory agency that administers and enforces federal campaign finance laws. The FEC has jurisdiction over the financing of campaigns for the U.S. House of Representatives, the U.S. Senate, the Presidency and the Vice Presidency. Established in 1975, the FEC is composed of six Commissioners who are nominated by the President and confirmed by the U.S. Senate.
